body_html:
Thanks for feedback, @mrry , @alextp .
Yes, I also think it weird to convert variable to mutable tensor. @alextp 's solution is better and straight. I didn't realize that ops.control_dependencies can work out the problem.

So I have two questions:

  1. Do we expect to support variable for input_ of tf.Print?
  2. If yes, how about returning the identical type always, I mean, tensor for tensor, mutable tensor for mutable tensor, and variable for variable ?
body_text:
Thanks for feedback, @mrry , @alextp .
Yes, I also think it weird to convert variable to mutable tensor. @alextp 's solution is better and straight. I didn't realize that ops.control_dependencies can work out the problem.
So I have two questions:

Do we expect to support variable for input_ of tf.Print?
If yes, how about returning the identical type always, I mean, tensor for tensor, mutable tensor for mutable tensor, and variable for variable ?
body:
Thanks for feedback, @mrry , @alextp . 
Yes, I also think it weird to convert variable to mutable tensor. @alextp 's solution is better and straight. I didn't realize that `ops.control_dependencies` can work out the problem.

So I have two questions:
1. Do we expect to support variable for `input_` of tf.Print?
2. If yes, how about returning the identical type always, I mean, tensor for tensor, mutable tensor for mutable tensor, and variable for variable ?
